page.title: 02STORNOWAY SOUTH - TRANSPORT
page.content:
More than 60{busses}a week operate from the bus station. These are run by companies such as D H M Maciver, Lochs Motor Transport and Hebridean Motor Transport. Four routes serve the town of Storrnoway and neighbouring villages. The rest serve the rural districts of Lewis, Harris and Bernera. The longest continuous journey is from Northton in Harris, taking 3 hrs. 15 mins.
The Post Office runs a{Post Bus}to Uig twice a week.
Caledonian Macbrayne operate a roll-on, roll-off ferry, the SUILVEN which makes to trip to Ullapool twice daily. It takes 3.5 hrs. to cover the 46 nautical miles.
